Portfolio

About

Hi there! My name is Sandra Lara and I'm from Barcelona. I am currently a Multimedia Engineer with 3 years of the Computer Engineering degree. I also have a BSc in Physics. Since I was 12 years old I have always been working on my own projects, from websites to 2D animations.

I love web and games development, always being able to add a touch of creativity. I learn fast and am very enthusiastic about what I do, always seeking for good finishes in my work, both technically and visually.

Thank you so much for visiting my portfolio!

Bittrip, the videogame

Platform: PC

Tools used: Unity, 3Ds Max, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop

Duration: < 1 year

Team size: 5

Role: Game Designer, Level Designer, Tech Artist

Overview

Bittrip is a single player, third-person platform adventure in 2.5D (3D with a 2D view) where a single bit called Bit (what a surprise!) has to travel through optical fiber, servers and wifi, dealing with evil bosses such as the big horse Troian, to deliver 1 bit of information. Bit can exist in two different modes - "one" and "zero" - each of which activates and deactivates Bit's abilities and its environment.

Detailed info

In this project the whole team had to deal and go through all stages of game development, from Pre-production to the Gold Master release.
I was primarily responsible for the game concept design, the design of characters (artistically) and their story, the design of the levels, their elements and the challenges and actions the player had to overcome to go through the game.
I was also responsible for the modelling of the 3D scenario elements, textures, lights and texture animations of the game for every level.

Other duties included programming and designing the GUI elements of each screen and some of the functionalities and behaviours of items in the scenario.

Screenshots

  • Date: September 2013 - June 2014
  • Category: Video game development

PR0SQUAD, for gamers by gamers

Duration: < 1 year

Team size: 5

Overview

PR0SQUAD is a social network for gamers. Its main aim is to create a gamer community where gamers can know each other by their gaming achievements and team up for multiplayer games.

Detailed info

In this project we designed and developed a project we wanted to release. As a part of the process we had to prepare and launch a crowdfunding campaign (we raised 1005â‚¬) and attended to the LS Talent Fair in Barcelona.
The web application is currently in the beta phase and we are willing to develop the release version in the following months. It is in the last stages of development.
I was responsible for the design of the corporate image and graphic elements of the webpage.

I was also responsible for the low fidelity and high fidelity of the web application (see images below).
Other duties included designing and preparing the crowdfunding campaign, its video and the actual web development stage of the application.
Link to the beta version
Link to the crowdfunding campaign

  • Date: September 2013 - June 2014
  • Category: Web design & development, Usability and UX

Wrath of Gods

Platform: PC

Tools used: VisualStudio (C#), Adobe Photoshop, MS Paint (for Pixel Art)

Duration: 3 months

Team size: 2

Role: Producer, Game Designer, Game Developer, Artist

Overview

2 players (P2P, to play as a LAN) strategy 2D game, acclimated in H.P. Lovecraft's gothic universe.
Each player has to choose one side (either Primigenian gods or Archetypical gods) and then choose one of the gods available for that side in particular. Each god controls a certain type of creatures. Each player has to kill all the creatures of the other god.

Detailed info

I conceived the game concept, and designed the game mechanics, challenges and elements. My duties included developing the P2P connection, GUI screens, the graphical interface and part of the map (C# in VisualStudio).

Screenshots

  • Date: June 2013
  • Category: Video game development

LHIVE (VIHDA)

Platform: PC

Tools used: Flash (Actionscript), Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator

Duration: 3 months

Team size: 2

Role: Producer, Game Designer, Game Developer, Artist

Overview

Single player 2D simulation - strategy game, conceived to raise awareness among youth about HIV and AIDS.
LHIVE (VIHDA, in spanish) is a simulation 2D strategy game conceived to aware young people about AIDS and HIV. In LHIVE the player starts with a 5 billion budget and has to use it strategically to avoid that the HIV spreads while he subsidizes investigation to find a vaccine. Each country starts from the actual situation of the virus at that certain country and evolves based on real statistics. This initial situation is specified by an external XML file that the game loads at the beginning.

The actions that the player does on each country have consecuences on the velocity of the spread of the virus and AIDS.
The player has to save the humanity before the virus exterminates the whole population.

Detailed info

In this project, I was primarily responsible for the game design, some of the elements of the GUI and the game development.
Other duties included programming the AI, searching for real data from each country and data for past years to workout the evolution of the virus.

  • Date: November 2012 - January 2013
  • Category: Video game development

LS Racer

Platform: PC

Tools used: OpenGL, DevIL, VisualStudio

Duration: 3 months

Team size: 2

Role: Game Developer

Overview

LS Racer is a single player, 3D racing game developed using OpenGL and DevIL for loading the textures. The player has 3 different cars to choose. THe first one is faster but the last one is stronger.
We programmed 3 different views (angled, top and at the ground).

Detailed info

My duties included programing the 3D model loading, the position of the lights, implementing the bounding boxes detection and part of the game mechanics.
I also took care of the textures and visual quality of the game.

  • Date: January 2012 - June 2012
  • Category: Video game development; OpenGL

Asleep

Duration: 4 months

Team size: 3

Role: Producer

Overview

Short film based on own script that shows a world where dreams are altered memories of other realities that everyone lives while sleeping except for the main character who, after a big shock, starts remembering everything.

Detailed info

In this project my responsibilities were producing and organizing the whole project, taking care of materials, schedules, actors, setting, etc. My duties also included taking care of lights and reflectors.

  • Date: February 2013 - June 2013
  • Category: Video production

Bombergirl

Tools used: Flash (ActionScript), PaintMS (for Pixel Art)

Duration: 2 weeks

Team size: 1

Role: Game Developer, Game Artist

Overview

Single player 2D game, version of the famous Bomberman game.

Detailed info

This was a solo project. I took care of the game development with ActionScript. Maps are dynamically generated from a matrix that specifies which type of square is each one.
I was also responsible for the creation of the graphical elements of the game (except the explotion frames).

  • Date: October 2012
  • Category: Video game development
